data.title: Our Partners
data.meta_description: Explore our hand-picked global partners and learn how to apply for partnerships.
data.text:
All MVPs are invited to take advantage of Manhattan’s annual Partner Day. This event develops and strengthens the relationships between our team and yours. We provide powerful insights into Manhattan’s solutions, including key differentiating factors and innovative capabilities.

Momentum is our annual customer meeting featuring hundreds of industry leaders, influencers and media.

Through the Discovery Center, MVPs get a chance to showcase their products and services to top companies from all over the world. In short, the companies and issues at Momentum reshape supply chain commerce across the globe.

Working with the only company that analysts designate as a Leader in WMS, TMS, and OMS. Our Manhattan Active solutions are all cloud-native and built on 100% microservices, so they’re always current and never need upgrading. In other words, they are the agile, scalable, innovative solutions required in distribution, transportation, retail, and inventory.

Platinum Partners

Receive the highest level of co-marketing and event support that includes exhibition space and co-marketing opportunities.

Gold Partners

Receive an annual business review, up to six press passes for events, and discounted product training.

Silver Partners

Have monthly alliance cadence meetings with the team, be eligible for social media content promotion, and much more.

Bronze Partners

Be eligible for single Momentum exhibition space, receive up to two complimentary event passes, and discounted product training.

Manhattan Associates provides global supply chain excellence to more than 1,200 customers worldwide that consider supply chain optimization core to their strategic market leadership.

The goal of the Manhattan MVP:™ Manhattan Value Partner program is to deliver comprehensive and cost-effective supply chain planning, execution and optimization solutions to an ever-increasing group of customers.
